page.title: 05Transport in Elkstone.
page.content: The Elkstone area is a prosperous part of Gloucester and this wealth is reflected in the very high level of car ownership. 98.21% of the area's households have a car and this is the second highest figure in the county. However, if a household has 1 car used by 1 member, the others will be cut off in such a rural area, where the nearest bus stop was over a mile away. To overcome this isolation Gloucestershire County Council operates a minibus service to Cheltenham, providing for a 3 and a half hour stay. However, the bus only operates on the first and the third Tuesdays of each month, so villagers cannot afford to forget anything vital!
